articleContent.title: Chord: 11th in A (Shape: A)
articleContent.content:
# Chord: 11th in A

## Description:
The 11th chord in A is a rich-sounding chord that consists of the notes A, C#, E, G, and D. This chord is built on the foundation of the A major triad (A-C#-E) with the addition of the G which is the dominant 7th, and the D which is the 11th interval relative to the root note A. The chord shape is often played using a barre chord shape at the 9th fret on the guitar.

## Notes and Intervals:
- A (Root)
- C# (Major 3rd)
- E (Perfect 5th)
- G (Dominant 7th)
- D (11th)

## Musical Flavor and Genre:
The 11th chord in A adds an extra layer of tension and color to the traditional A major chord. The presence of the 11th interval gives it a jazzy and sophisticated sound. This chord is often used in jazz, funk, and R&B music to add depth and complexity to chord progressions.

## Songs:
1. "Afro Blue" by John Coltrane
2. "Isn't She Lovely" by Stevie Wonder
3. "Red Clay" by Freddie Hubbard
